item.title: BlackBerry Torch Fires Up Mobile Business
item.description:
The BlackBerry Torch symbolizes a new era in mobile business communication, much like the Olympic torch marks the start of the Games. This smartphone combines a touch screen with a slide-out QWERTY keyboard and introduces the BlackBerry 6 operating system. BlackBerry highlights the new OS’s ability to aggregate social media and RSS feeds, enable faster web browsing with multiple open tabs, provide universal search functionality, offer enhanced multimedia with a YouTube app, and ensure easy setup and personalization with a user-friendly design...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/blackberry-torch-fires-up-mobile-business/

item.title: Cell Phone Wireless Broadband
item.description:
Cell phones today are capable of much more than just voice calls. The mobile networks have evolved to carry both voice and data, offering wireless broadband internet access that rivals DSL and cable connections. If you haven’t explored mobile internet recently, you might be surprised by its speed and availability. Currently, two competing systems are widely available, with two even faster networks in their early stages. AT&T promotes its HSDPA and EDGE networks, notably featuring the Apple iPhone...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/cell-phone-wireless-broadband/
